value.title: AI tech enables robots to feel pain, stitch their wounds
value.excerpt: Researchers from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, develop a way for robots to have the AI to recognise pain and self-repair when damaged.

value.title: The Path to Ethical AI Starts With Collaboration
value.excerpt: To the layman, the word-set of ethical AI is a misnomer. AI oftentimes still conjures visions of a dystopian future in which artificial intelligence runs rampant, dominating humankind. Thanks to modern-era entertainment in films such as 2001:A Space Odyssey (HAL 3000) or The Terminator,

value.title: Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (BOTZ) at a 52-Week High
value.excerpt: For investors looking for momentum, Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF BOTZ is probably a suitable pick. The fund just hit a 52-week high and is up 99.5% from its 52-week low price of $14.

value.title: Researchers detail LaND, AI that learns from autonomous vehicle disengagements
value.excerpt: AI researchers often disengagements as a signal ... 2,00 disengagements produced during the LaND training on Berkeley sidewalks. Delivery robot startup Kiwibot also operates at UC Berkeley and ...

value.title: The relentless threat of artificial intelligence taking our jobs away
value.excerpt: Whether AI will take our jobs or create new ones is one of the greatest debates of the modern world. Every instance when a revolutionary new technology comes in, the same thought fearfully raises its head.

value.title: Rebel Foods bets on robotics, A/B testing to scale food biz
value.excerpt: Rebel Foods grew from its earlier avatar ‘Faasos’ to a multi-brand food firm which currently houses more than 15 brands such as Behrouz Biryani, Oven Story Pizza, Sweet Truth, Slay Everyday, Firangi Bake,

value.title: Biped robot maker Agility raises $20 million
value.excerpt: Agility Robotics said on Thursday it raised $20 million in funding, in a round led by Silicon Valley venture capital firms DCVC and Playground, as two-legged robots start walking out of the lab and into the workplace.

value.title: Army’s ‘Team Ignite’ Sets Futuristic R&D Targets: AI, Robotics, Autonomy
value.excerpt: "We ultimately want this Team Ignite to become the way we do business -- it's increased collaboration with the right partners in the right events," says Maj. Gen. John George, head of Army Combat Capabilities and Development Command (CCDC).

value.title: Brazil launches artificial intelligence center
value.excerpt: The largest research facility in the country with focus on the technologies is run jointly by IBM and public sector bodies.

value.title: Dataloop raises $11M Series A round for its AI data management platform
value.excerpt: Dataloop, a Tel Aviv-based startup that specializes in helping businesses manage the entire data lifecycle for their AI projects, including helping them annotate their datasets, today announced that it has now raised a total of $16 million.

value.title: Google launches autonomous robot to analyse farms with artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Google has launched an autonomous robot which uses artificial intelligence to monitor crops. Powered by solar panels, the buggy travels through crops using cameras and sensors to predict agricultural yields and help farmers decide how much pesticide and fertiliser to use.

value.title: How robotics technology is beneficial in a modern warehouse
value.excerpt: The 6 River Systems platform complements Expeditors’ core technology strategy of focusing on investments that deliver value to our customers and our operations.

value.title: These 8 tech companies are using AI to improve healthcare, renewable energy, and more
value.excerpt: We often see news and headlines about the dark side of AI, its weaponization, and “algorithmic warfare”. A plethora of AI-driven, dystopian paradigms await us in the future, but there is also a bright side!

value.title: Robots will watch, learn and reason in AI’s augmented reality
value.excerpt: Australia has no choice but to step up investment in artificial intelligence, says Anton van den Hengel, whose Adelaide research group was awarded 20m in the federal budget last week to boost Australias position in this highly competitive research field.

value.title: Robotics Startup Miko raises INR 23 Cr From Stride Ventures, Angel Investors
value.excerpt: This infusion comes after the startup had raised INR 15.98 Cr from investors such as WNS group CEO and NASSCOM’s chairman Keshav Rurugesh, Inderjit Kaur Arora, Suresh Subramani, Giridhar Sanjeevi and a few others last year.

value.title: Can Robots Help People With Their Mental Health?
value.excerpt: A study found that most think robots can support their mental health better than people, but experts say there are crucial human qualities technology can’t replicate.

value.title: Adorable red self-driving robot delivering mail in Japan during pandemic
value.excerpt: A Japan Post mail delivery robot debuts in Tokyo, and is being tested to keep human interaction to a minimum during the coronavirus crisis.

value.title: PlayStation founder Ken Kutaragi has started a new career in robotics
value.excerpt: Ken Kutaragi, the former Sony executive widely credited as ‘The Father of PlayStation’, has started a new career in the robotics industry. Since late August Kutaragi has been working as the CEO of Tokyo’s Ascent Robotics,

value.title: Study Explores the Use of Robots, AI to Ease COVID-19 Pressures on Hospitals
value.excerpt: Hospitals across the globe could raise their productivity and efficiency as well as increase safety and quality while limiting and decreasing charges.

value.title: Torc Robotics to scale self-driving fleet with Daimler test trucks
value.excerpt: Torc Robotics announced that it will scale its self-driving truck testing in the southwest in early 2021 using an enhanced prototype truck developed with Daimler Trucks North America (DTNA).AdvertisementClick Here to Read MoreAdvertisement This new generation of Freightliner Cascadia test trucks bolsters Torc’s capability to develop and test its Level 4 self-driving technology,

value.title: PlayStation Inventor Starts New Career Making Robots for No Pay
value.excerpt: Ken Kutaragi, the legendary inventor of the PlayStation gaming console, is taking on one of the hardest jobs in robotics. And he’s getting paid nothing to do it.

value.title: Future Trends in Robotics Should Translate to More Upside for “UBOT”
value.excerpt: The robotics industry has proven its mettle amid the Covid-19 pandemic with machines taking the place of humans in order to stave off further infections from the virus. That said, a recent Robotics & Automation News article identified additional trends that can only further the expansion of the robotics industry--good news for ETFs like the Robotics & AI Bull 3X ETF  (NYSEArca: UBOT).

value.title: Enhanced computer vision, sensors raise manufacturing stakes for robots as a service
value.excerpt: Firms developing computer vision technology for standard robots, developments in 3D vision and so-called “Robots as a Service” are defining the next wave of automation.

value.title: Neocis raises $72 million for its dental surgery robot
value.excerpt: Dental robotics startup Neocis today closed a $70 million ... “The Yomi planning software … leverages AI techniques to guide the surgeon in planning the case safely, for example providing ...

value.title: Startups joining SK Telecom’s accelerator include AI-driven mapping and vision for delivery robots
value.excerpt: We don’t often cover telecom technology startups, but it’s periodically worth checking in to see what’s happening in that space. We can get a good indication from the latest cohort to emerge from an accelerator associated with South Korea’s largest wireless carrier,

value.title: Anand Mahindra Backs Robotics Startup Genrobotics as the Latter Ramps up its Fight Against Manual Scavenging
value.excerpt: Genrobotics has raised INR 2.5 crore in Pre Series A funding round from Unicorn India Ventures, Anand Mahindra and SE

value.title: Robot reapers and AI: Just another day on the farm
value.excerpt: Technology is now enabling farmers to manage each section of the farm based on its unique conditions and needs. A good example of this in action is the spraying of herbicides, which had traditionally been done at the same rate across the whole field.

value.title: Dexterous robots are coming to the US Air Force
value.excerpt: The military branch has awarded a contract to a robotics firm to develop artificial intelligence-based dexterous robots.

value.title: Study Shows People Prefer Robot Over Their Boss: 6 Ways To Be A Leader People Prefer
value.excerpt: These are stressful times—among the most stressful in history—and people need help. Often, they turn to their employers and specifically their leaders. But they don’t always get what they need. A new global study reports people actually prefer robots to humans for help with mental health issues.
